description:
# nova list --name \*
ERROR: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-e399bee0-2491-4e4a-9197-944b19c86075)
title: HTTP 500 when `nova list --name` contains invalid regexp

comments.content:
# nova list --name \*
ERROR: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-e399bee0-2491-4e4a-9197-944b19c86075)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jhenner

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/104931
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
With the proposed change, we'll see

stack@bigblue:~$ nova list --name "*"
ERROR (BadRequest): (OperationalError) (1139, "Got error 'repetition-operator operand invalid' from regexp") (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-8020ebd9-5286-45a9-b19c-a6fbfb33ca9c)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: @Preeti, are you still working on this bug?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anusha-unnam

comments.content:
This is an automated cleanup. This bug report has been closed because it
is older than 18 months and there is no open code change to fix this.
After this time it is unlikely that the circumstances which lead to
the observed issue can be reproduced.

If you can reproduce the bug, please:
* reopen the bug report (set to status "New")
* AND add the detailed steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)
* AND leave a comment "CONFIRMED FOR: <RELEASE_NAME>"
  Only still supported release names are valid (LIBERTY, MITAKA, OCATA, NEWTON).
  Valid example: CONFIRMED FOR: LIBERTY
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
